page.title: Outreach & Education
page.subtitle: Inspiring the Next Generation of Agricultural Scientists
page.intro: Our project includes several outreach efforts designed to engage students, teachers, and community members in cutting-edge agricultural research. Through hands-on learning experiences and educational programs, we bridge the gap between university research and K-12 education.

programs.title: Summer Research Camp
programs.shortDescription: Immersive week-long experience for high school students exploring plant stress research and agricultural technology.
highlights: Meet MSU researchers and graduate students

overview.title: Camp Overview
overview.content: The iPACERS Summer Research Camp offers high school students a unique opportunity to participate in real agricultural research. Students will work alongside MSU faculty and graduate students to understand how plants respond to heat and drought stress using state-of-the-art sensing technologies.
overview.prerequisites: No prior experience required. Open to students grades 9-12 with interest in science, agriculture, or technology.
objectives: Understand plant responses to environmental stress
Learn to use advanced sensing equipment (PlantEye, OAK cameras, spectroscopy)
Develop data collection and analysis skills
Explore careers in agricultural sciences and engineering

schedule.title: Schedule & Activities

activities: Introduction to heat and drought stress concepts
Hands-on: Measuring plant temperature with thermal cameras

schedule.dailySchedule: 8:30 AM - 4:00 PM with lunch break and snacks provided

apply.title: How to Apply
eligibility: Interest in science, agriculture, or technology
Able to commit to full week program
requirements: Short essay (500 words): Why you're interested in agricultural research
apply.selectionProcess: Applications reviewed on rolling basis. Students selected based on interest, essay quality, and diversity of perspectives. Limited spots available.

forParents.title: Parent Information
details: Daily drop-off: 8:15 AM / Pick-up: 4:15 PM at ABE Building
Lunch, snacks, and all materials provided at no cost
Students should bring: Water bottle, sunscreen, comfortable outdoor shoes
Supervision: Minimum 1 adult per 8 students at all times
Safety: All activities follow MSU safety protocols; students receive safety training
Communication: Daily email updates and photos shared with parents
Emergency contact available 24/7 during camp week

forTeachers.title: Teacher Partnership Opportunities
details: Bring your class: Group registration available for school groups
Curriculum alignment: Activities aligned with MS Science Standards
Professional development: Teachers attend free, receive continuing education credit
Classroom extensions: Take-home lesson plans and activities
Equipment loans: Borrow soil moisture sensors for your classroom
Guest speakers: Schedule researcher visits to your school

testimonials.quote: I never knew agricultural science involved so much technology! This camp opened my eyes to amazing career possibilities.
The graduate students were so supportive and made complex concepts easy to understand. I'm now considering agricultural engineering for college!
My daughter came home every day excited to tell us what she learned. This program sparked a genuine passion for science.

questions.q: Do I need prior experience in agriculture or science?
questions.a: No! The camp is designed for students of all backgrounds. We'll teach you everything you need to know.
Bring a water bottle, sunscreen, hat, and comfortable shoes for outdoor work. We provide all research equipment, materials, and meals.

questions.q: Will we be outside in the heat?
questions.a: We work both indoors (greenhouse, labs) and outdoors (field sites). All outdoor activities include shade breaks and hydration. We monitor weather and adjust schedule for safety.

questions.q: Can I use my phone during camp?
questions.a: Phones are allowed during breaks and lunch. During activities, we ask students to focus on hands-on learning, but phones can be used for taking photos of experiments.
No, this is a day camp. Students commute daily to MSU campus.
We review applications holistically, considering your interest, essay, and recommendation. We aim for diverse cohorts representing different schools and backgrounds.

programs.title: Other Outreach Activities
programs.shortDescription: Workshops, school visits, extension events, and community engagement throughout the year.

activities.title: Workshops & Field Days
activities.description: Interactive workshops and field demonstrations for students, teachers, and community members to learn about agricultural research and technology.
activities.audience: Middle & high school students, teachers, farmers
activities.howToParticipate: Events are free and open to the public. Registration required. Contact us to host a workshop at your school or organization.

activities.title: School Visits & Classroom Modules
activities.description: We bring the research to you! MSU researchers and graduate students visit K-12 classrooms with hands-on activities and lessons aligned with state science standards.
activities.materials: All materials and equipment provided. Downloadable lesson plans available for teacher use.
activities.howToRequest: Submit request form at least 4 weeks in advance. Priority given to Mississippi schools within 100 miles of MSU.

activities.title: Extension & Community Events
activities.description: Partnering with MSU Extension Service to bring research findings to farmers, county agents, and community members across Mississippi.
recentEvents: Sunflower River County Extension Demo - October 2025
activities.howToEngage: Contact your county extension office or email us directly to schedule an event or request information.
